question: Sophie has a flower bed that is 172 meters long. Sophie wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Sophie's flowers grow 3 inches wide so she needs to leave 11.5 meters between every plant. Sophie already owns 10 flowers. Each flowering plant costs €7 at the store, how much money will Sophie spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Sophie's flower bed is 172 meters / 11.5 meters per plant = <<172/11.5=14>>14 plants needed.
Sophie needs to buy 14 plants - 10 plants = <<14-10=4>>4 plants needed to purchase.
Sophie will spend 4 plants * €7 = €<<4*7=34>>34.
#### 34
